Detailed Description

A class for Pomodoro objects. Contains all the operations regarding a Pomodoro, as well as its graphical representation (a QLCDNumber). It is studied for re-use, as it is completely isolated from the rest of the project. It emits signals either when the pomodoro is finished or broken.

See also:
http://doc.trolltech.com/4.5/qtimer.html
An example on how to use it: 
   include <QApplication>
   include "pomodoro.hpp"

   int main(int argc, char *argv[])
   {
      QApplication app(argc, argv);
      Pomodoro p(0,25,0); // a pomodoro in an indipendent window, with length of 25 minutes
      p.show();           // show the pomodoro
      p.Start();          // start the pomodoro
      return app.exec();
   }

int  minutes,

)

Constructor of a Pomodoro. Sets the attributes and calls ShowTimer() automatically.

Parameters:
parent a pointer to the parent widget (0 if we want a new window)
minutes an integer for the length of Pomodoro (default 25)
seconds an integer for the length of Pomodoro (default 0)

mIsRunning

void Pomodoro::PomodoroBroken (  )  [signal]

Signal launched when the Pomodoro is broken

void Pomodoro::PomodoroFinished (  )  [signal]

Signal launched when the Pomodoro finishes normally

void Pomodoro::Reset (  ) 

Resets the Pomodoro. This method is just for having a single Pomodoro object during the execution of the program.

void Pomodoro::Start (  ) 

Starts a Pomodoro. Sets the signal handler, starts the internal timer, sets mIsRunning to true. It calls Run() as last thing.

See also:
Run()

PomodoroBroken()

void Pomodoro::Stop (  ) 

Stops a Pomodoro. If it detects that the pomodoro was broken, it launches a PomodoroBroken() signal. It stops the internal timer, and sets mIsRunning to false.
